Although the president tends to choose justices who reflect his or her own political ideology, he or she does not always nominate a candidate from the president's party (E). Congress sets the salaries and benefits of Supreme Court justices (D).

content:
A low percentage of voter turnout is often caused by

I. mobility of the electorate

II. the perception of obvious differences between candidates or parties

III. lack of political efficacy

IV. dissatisfaction with things as they are

answers.A: <label>A. II only</label>
answers.B: <label>B. I and IV only</label>
answers.C: <label>C. III only</label>
answers.D: <label>D. I and II only</label>
answers.E: <label>E. I and III only</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: E

Explanation:

E. Both the mobility of the electorate and lack of political efficacy are reasons for low voter turnout. Political efficacy is the belief that a person can influence politics and public policymaking. Dissatisfaction with the status quo tends to produce a higher voter turnout. If candidates or parties show distinct differences in their programs or ideologies, voters tend to feel that their vote is more significant.

content: Cabinet-level executive departments are created by

answers.A: <label>A. Congress</label>
answers.B: <label>B. the Constitution</label>
answers.C: <label>C. the president</label>
answers.D: <label>D. the Supreme Court</label>
answers.E: <label>E. recommendation of other cabinet-level offices</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

A. Congress creates executive departments, including those at the cabinet level.

content: When the House of Representatives sits as one large committee, it is sitting as

answers.A: <label>A. the full house</label>
answers.B: <label>B. a quorum</label>
answers.C: <label>C. a standing committee</label>
answers.D: <label>D. the Committee of the Whole</label>
answers.E: <label>E. the Committee at Large</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

D. The House of Representatives sitting as one large committee is the Committee of the Whole. A standing committee (C) is a permanent committee of the House or Senate. A quorum (B) is the number of members who must be present for business to take place. The full house(A) and the Committee at Large (E) are not types of House committees.

content: Which of the following is a false statement regarding minor parties?

answers.A: <label>A. Third parties have been useful in introducing new ideas in American politics.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Minor parties have played an important role in reforming American politics.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Minor parties have usually been successful in getting candidates elected to office.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Minor parties may also be classified as ideological parties.</label>
answers.E: <label>E. Minor parties tend to focus on single issues.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

C. Minor parties have not been very successful in electing candidates to office. No president and only a few members of Congress have been elected from minor parties. Major parties have frequently adopted the ideas of third parties into their platform (A, B). Many minor parties are ideological, or based upon a set of social, political, or economic beliefs (D). Minor parties often tend to focus on a single public policy matter such as abolition, abortion, or prohibition (E).

content: Checking with party members on party policy and helping the floor leader to determine if there are enough votes to pass a particular issue is part of the job description of which of the following members of Congress?

answers.A: <label>A. minority floor leaders</label>
answers.B: <label>B. whips</label>
answers.C: <label>C. the Speaker of the House</label>
answers.E: <label>E. committee chairpersons</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

B. Floor whips check on party members and assist the floor leader in gathering the votes necessary to pass or defeat a bill. The minority floor leader (A) is the major spokesperson for the minority party and organizes opposition to the majority party. The Speaker of the House (C) is the presiding officer of the House. The president pro tempore is the presiding officer of the Senate in the absence of the vice president (D). Committee chairpersons (E) set agendas, assign members to subcommittees, and decide whether the committee will hold public hearings.

content: When the United States government is party to a case, who represents the United States before the Supreme Court?

answers.A: <label>A. the attorney general</label>
answers.B: <label>B. the chief justice of the Supreme Court</label>
answers.C: <label>C. the solicitor general</label>
answers.D: <label>D. the secretary of justice</label>
answers.E: <label>E. the general counsel for the president</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

C. The solicitor general represents the U.S. government before the Supreme Court.

content: With reference to the executive branch, the Twenty-Fifth Amendment establishes

answers.A: <label>A. a system of checks and balances</label>
answers.B: <label>B. direct election of the president</label>
answers.C: <label>C. a direct change in the electoral college</label>
answers.D: <label>D. more power to be given to the vice president</label>
answers.E: <label>E. presidential succession and disability procedures</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: E

Explanation:

E. The Twenty-Fifth Amendment calls for a method to deal with presidential succession and disability.

content: Which of the following is a reason for the decline in voting?

answers.A: <label>A. decrease in the number of eligible voters</label>
answers.B: <label>B. decline in parties' ability to mobilize voters</label>
answers.C: <label>C. same-day registration in a larger number of states</label>
answers.D: <label>D. penalties for nonvoting</label>
answers.E: <label>E. increase in party loyalty</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

B. A decline in the ability of political parties to mobilize voters is a reason for the decline in voter turnout. The expansion, not a decrease, in the size of the electorate often results in a lower percentage of voter turnout. (A) For example, after the increase in the size of the electorate caused by the ratification of the Twenty-Sixth Amendment, the low turnout of new voters between the ages of 18 and 21 decreased the percentage of voter turnout. The few states that have same-day registration have shown an increase in voter turnout (C). In recent years, party loyalty has tended to decrease (E). There are no penalties for nonvoting (D).

content: Which of the following is true of the incumbency effect?

answers.A: <label>A. Members of the House of Representatives benefit more than members of the Senate.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Members of the Senate benefit more than members of the House of Representatives.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Members of the House of Representatives and Senate benefit equally.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Incumbency does not benefit either members of the House of Representatives or Senate.</label>
answers.E: <label>E. The president benefits from the incumbency effect.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

A. Because the terms of the members of the House of Representatives last only two years, the incumbency effect benefits members of the House of Representatives more than it benefits the members of the Senate.

content: Which of the following would probably be least likely to vote?

answers.A: <label>A. a high school dropout</label>
answers.B: <label>B. a wealthy white businessman</label>
answers.C: <label>C. a woman professional</label>
answers.D: <label>D. a labor union member</label>
answers.E: <label>E. an active Roman Catholic</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

A. Because education is a key factor in voter participation, the high school dropout would probably be the least likely to vote. Those with higher incomes and persons involved in the professions or business are more likely to vote (B, C). Union members and persons who actively participate in their religion are also more likely to vote (D, E).

content: The issuance of an executive order falls under the president's

answers.A: <label>A. legislative powers</label>
answers.B: <label>B. diplomatic powers</label>
answers.C: <label>C. executive powers</label>
answers.D: <label>D. judicial powers</label>
answers.E: <label>E. military powers</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

C. The president's issuance of an executive order to carry out a policy is an example of the executive powers of the presidency. An example of the president's legislative powers is the veto power (A). The president's diplomatic powers include issuing executive agreements (B). Granting reprieves and pardons is a judicial power of the presidency (D). Providing for domestic order is one of the president's military powers (E).

content: After 1950, the success of the civil rights movement was aided most by

answers.A: <label>A. African Americans lowering their expectations</label>
answers.B: <label>B. the passage of the Fourteenth Amendment</label>
answers.C: <label>C. a shift of the movement to the courts</label>
answers.D: <label>D. African Americans winning election to public office</label>
answers.E: <label>E. decreased participation by interest groups in the civil rights movement</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

C. The success of the civil rights movement after 1950 was aided by the movement's shift to the courts. The Fourteenth Amendment, ratified in 1868, defined citizenship and the rights of citizens (B). The number of African Americans in public office did not increase significantly until the 1970s (D). Interest groups such as the NAACP continue to promote the goals of the civil rights movement (E).

content: As a special interest group, the National Organization for Women was organized for the purpose of

answers.A: <label>A. ratifying an equal rights amendment for women</label>
answers.B: <label>B. creating more jobs for women</label>
answers.C: <label>C. dealing with the abortion issue in America</label>
answers.D: <label>D. advocating for legislation to protect women's rights</label>
answers.E: <label>E. promoting a national women's party devoted to the purpose of electing the first woman president</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

D. The goal of the National Organization for Women is to protect women's rights through the passage of legislation.

content: Which of the following is NOT true of federalism?

answers.A: <label>A. A state may not unreasonably discriminate against the resident of another state.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The federal government handles matters of national concern.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. States may extradite fugitives from one state to another.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. States must honor another state's public acts, laws, and records.</label>
answers.E: <label>E. The powers of the federal government are less than the powers of the state governments.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: E

Explanation:

E. Under federalism the national and state governments each have certain authority over the same territory and people. A constitution outlines the powers and prohibitions pertaining to each level of government.

content: The Supreme Court case of Gideon v. Wainwright was a significant case in that it

answers.A: <label>A. caused law enforcement officers to advise the criminally accused of their rights</label>
answers.B: <label>B. called for attorney rights to be applied at the state level as well as at the federal level</label>
answers.C: <label>C. called for the accused to be confronted by witnesses against them</label>
answers.D: <label>D. stated that search warrants were constitutionally required under all circumstances</label>
answers.E: <label>E. allowed judges to determine what constitutes double jeopardy in a case</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

B.Gideon v. Wainwright provided for attorney rights in state cases. This case was used by the Supreme Court to apply the Sixth Amendment to the states through the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment. Choice (A) refers to Miranda v. Arizona. The Sixth Amendment guarantees the right of the accused to be confronted by witnesses against them (C) and prohibits double jeopardy (E). Several Courtcases, including Terry v. Ohio, place limits on the constitutional guarantee of protection against unreasonable search and seizure (D).

content: A bill that has been held up in a committee may be forced out of that committee by which of the following methods?

answers.A: <label>A. joint resolution</label>
answers.B: <label>B. House call by the Speaker</label>
answers.C: <label>C. discharge petition</label>
answers.D: <label>D. cloture petition</label>
answers.E: <label>E. cannot be forced out of a committee in either house of Congress</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

C. Bills held up in committee may be forced out of committee by members of the House of Representatives so that the whole house may debate the bill. A joint resolution (A) is a proposal for action that is issued by both the House and Senate acting together; it has the force of law when passed. A cloture petition (D) is a request for a Senate vote to limit or end floor debate.

content: Party dealignment might be occurring if

answers.A: <label>A. government tends to be "divided"</label>
answers.B: <label>B. one party tends to win control of government more often</label>
answers.C: <label>C. support for minor parties is declining</label>
answers.D: <label>D. political parties are becoming more centralized</label>
answers.E: <label>E. people are voting Republican more often than they are voting Democrat</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

A. One sign of party dealignment may be "divided government," with one party controlling the executive branch and the other party controlling one or both houses of Congress.

content: Which of the following is NOT a check on the power of the federal courts by Congress?

answers.A: <label>A. changing the tenure of justices</label>
answers.B: <label>B. confirmation of appointments</label>
answers.C: <label>C. changing the court's jurisdiction</label>
answers.D: <label>D. altering the number of justices</label>
answers.E: <label>E. amending the Constitution</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

A. Changing the tenure of judges is not a check on the power of the federal courts by Congress. Tenure for federal judges is established by the Constitution. The remaining answer choices represent checks on the power of the judicial branch.

content:
The War Powers Resolution of 1973 requires

I. the president to inform Congress within 48 hours of any commitment of American troops abroad

II. the president to keep troops abroad for at least 60 days

III. the president to follow the guidelines of the Constitution regarding war

answers.A: <label>A. I only</label>
answers.B: <label>B. II only</label>
answers.C: <label>C. III only</label>
answers.D: <label>D. I and II only</label>
answers.E: <label>E. I, II, and III</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

A. The War Powers Resolution requires the president to inform Congress within 48 hours of any commitment of U.S. troops abroad.

content: Which of the following historic Supreme Court cases called for apportionment of representative seats in Congress to be as equal as possible?
explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

D. In Wesberry v. Sanders the Court ruled that the apportionment of representative seats in Congress must be as equal as possible. Marbury v. Madison established the power of judicial review (A). McCulloch v. Maryland established the supremacy of the national government (B). Mapp v. Ohio applied the exclusionary rule to state courts (C). Miranda v. Arizona requires that anyone arrested for a crime be advised of the right to counsel and the right to remain silent (E).

content: A list of cases to be heard is called a(n)

answers.B: <label>B. agenda of cases</label>
answers.C: <label>C. docket</label>
answers.D: <label>D. court agenda</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

C. A docket is a list of cases to be heard by the court.

content: Compared to a political conservative, a political liberal generally

answers.A: <label>A. favors limited governmental involvement in civil rights issues</label>
answers.B: <label>B. supports active governmental involvement in the promotion of individual welfare</label>
answers.C: <label>C. favors a limited governmental role in the promotion of national security</label>
answers.D: <label>D. supports more traditional values and lifestyles</label>
answers.E: <label>E. promotes a limited governmental role in aiding individuals economically</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

B. A political liberal tends to believe in active governmental involvement to promote individual welfare. The remaining answer choices describe a political conservative.

content: The Constitution of the United States was written as a direct result of

answers.A: <label>A. the American Revolution</label>
answers.B: <label>B. orders issued by the Second Continental Congress</label>
answers.C: <label>C. the failure of state governments under the new federal union</label>
answers.D: <label>D. the decisions reached at the Annapolis Convention</label>
answers.E: <label>E. the failure of the Articles of Confederation to provide adequate direction for the union</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: E

Explanation:

E. The Constitution of the United States was written as a direct result of the failure of the Articles of Confederation to provide adequate direction for the Union. The Annapolis Convention (D) failed to reach a decision regarding the weaknesses of the Articles of Confederation. The Second Continental Congress (B) was the government that oversaw the conduct of the American Revolution. The writing of the Articles of Confederation was a direct result of the American Revolution (A). The state governments were stronger than the national government under the Articles (C).

content: When voters elect a representative from a district within a state, and that representative is selected from several candidates, what type of election system is that state using?

answers.A: <label>A. a general ticket system</label>
answers.B: <label>B. a single-member district system</label>
answers.C: <label>C. at-large voting</label>
answers.D: <label>D. a one-person one-vote system</label>
answers.E: <label>E. gerrymandering</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

B. A single-member district allows for the election of only one winner to represent the voters. At-large voting (C) involves an election in which candidates for office compete throughout the district or state as a whole. The one-person one-vote system (D) is the concept that each legislative district within a state should contain the same number of eligible voters to assure equal representation based on population. Gerrymandering (E) is the redrawing of legislative districts to give an advantage to a political party or group.

content: Which of the following include the president's key foreign and military advisors?

answers.A: <label>A. State Department</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Central Intelligence Agency</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Federal Bureau of Investigation</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Department of Homeland Security</label>
answers.E: <label>E. National Security Council</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: E

Explanation:

E. As part of the Executive Office of the President, the National Security Council is composed of the president's key foreign and military advisors. The Department of Homeland Security (D) is a department with cabinet status. It is in charge of the prevention of terrorist attacks within the United States. Another cabinet-level department, the Department of State (A), advises the president on foreign policy. The CIA (B) gathers secret information essential to national defense. The FBI (C) defends the United States against terrorism and enforces U.S. criminal laws.

content: How many presidents of the United States have been impeached?

answers.A: <label>A. two</label>
answers.B: <label>B. three</label>
answers.C: <label>C. one</label>
answers.D: <label>D. four</label>
answers.E: <label>E. none</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

B. Three United States presidents have been impeached, although none were convicted: Andrew Johnson in 1868, Bill Clinton in 1998, and Donald Trump in 2019 and 2021. Trump is the only president (and only federal officeholder) to be impeached twice.

content: Which constitutional amendment provided for the direct election of senators?

answers.A: <label>A. Twelfth Amendment</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Sixteenth Amendment</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Twentieth Amendment</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Fourteenth Amendment</label>
answers.E: <label>E. Seventeenth Amendment</label>

E. The Seventeenth Amendment provided for the direct election of senators. The Twelfth Amendment (A) changed the method of voting in the electoral college. The Sixteenth Amendment (B) established a federal income tax. The Twentieth Amendment (C) set the terms of office of the president and members of Congress, while theFourteenth Amendment (D) defined citizenship and the rights of citizens.

content: Which of the following is not considered to be one of the special or legislative courts in the federal court system?

answers.A: <label>A. the Territorial Courts</label>
answers.B: <label>B. the United States Tax Court</label>
answers.C: <label>C. the United States Claims Court</label>
answers.D: <label>D. the Courts of Appeals</label>
answers.E: <label>E. the Court of Military Appeals</label>
